results.name: Triangle read by rows: number of binary sequences with no isolated 1's.
comment: T(n,k) = number of 0-1 sequences of length n with exactly k 1's, none of which is isolated.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, w, s) option remember; `if`(n=0,
mathematica: a[n_, 0]/;n>=0 := 1; a[n_, k_]/;k>n || k<0 :=0; a[n_, 1]:=0; a[2, 2]=1; a[n_, k_]/;n>=3 && 2 <= k <= n := a[n, k] = 1 + Sum[a[n-(r+1), k-j], {r, 2, n-1}, {j, Max[2, r-1-(n-k)], Min[r, k]}] This recurrence counts a(n, k) by r = location of first 1 followed by a 0, j = length of run which this first 1 terminates.
xref: Cf. A180177 (same sequence with rows reversed).
